duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage safety, compliance, and orientation of new drivers, ensuring adherence to local, state, federal, DOT, and OSHA rules and regulations.
Develop and implement corporate safety and loss prevention efforts, and compliance programs to integrate safety policies and procedures into business planning.
Oversee all aspects of safety training and driver orientations program to maintain a strong safety ethic among drivers and meet training objectives.
Provide reporting on vehicle, cargo loss, and injury by division, and prepare accident analysis and driver demographic reports.
Manage the department's annual operating budget, cost center, AP, and AR.
Supervise road testing of all driver applicants, ensuring compliance with company and federal standards.
Participate in continuous improvement activities by reviewing, changing, and improving processes aligned with organizational goals.
Assist with loss prevention, company-wide compliance efforts, and governmental reporting and compliance.
Monitor Safe stats, Root Cause Analysis process, DOT accident reporting, and monthly DOT data reporting.
Act as liaison between other divisions/departments in support of safety and compliance efforts.
Management of C-TPAT and Customs/in-bond shipment compliance.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree (B.A.) from a four-year college or university; or 5-7 years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience in the industry.
Firm understanding of the transportation industry with a strong working knowledge of safety, loss prevention, and DOT and OSHA regulations.
Proven ability to form strategic partnerships with Operations and to collaboratively instill a Safety culture and standards.
Excellent organizational skills and ability to manage and prioritize workload in a fast-paced environment.
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook) required.
Excellent communication skills (written, listening, and verbal).
Willing and able to travel occasionally, including overnight travel.
